articles.title: AP Technology SummaryBrief at 7:45 p.m. EDT
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman and other US tech leaders testify to Congress on AI competition with China. Lawmakers and technologists agree AI could transform global business, culture and geopolitics. Microsoft and Advanced Micro Devices executives testify on Capitol Hill about the biggest opportunities, risks and needs facing the AI industry.

articles.title: Cudekai Launches Free AI Humanizer to Transform Robotic Text into Natural-Sounding Content
articles.author: Get News
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has become a go-to tool for fast content creation. However, the results often feel robotic to the user because the AI has already written the content and there's no need to change the AI's opinion on the subject. It's a good tool for writing blog posts and drafting emails.

articles.title: Being Human With AI Launches Free AI Ethics Curriculum for Kids to Navigate Urgent Safety Risks
articles.author: Get News
articles.summary: BHWAI announces the beta launch of its free AI ethics curriculum for children aged 9-13. It addresses critical safety concerns in today's digital landscape. It teaches kids to engage AI as a trusted tool, not a crutch, in a healthy, ethical relationship.

articles.title: NEWEN AI Gears Up for Global Expansion
articles.author: Get News
articles.summary: Newen AI is a leading AI-powered big data analytics company. Newen AI has over 20 years of experience and a dominant share in the market. It delivers AI-Powered Analytics and Real-Time K-Trend Intelligence.    It is accelerating its entry into the global market.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence creates avatars that quickly turn spoken words into sign language for the deaf
articles.author: Hans Bader
articles.summary: Silence Speaks provides AI-powered avatars turning spoken words into sign language in real time. NYU Langone Health is testing an AI technology called FOX, which uses psychoacoustic tests and other novel methods to calibrate patients' devices to the appropriate pitch and volume.

articles.title: Apple Inc. (AAPL) – AI Innovation Key to Sustained Market Leadership
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) ranks 3rd on our list of AI stocks on Wall Street's radar right now. China's President Xi Jinping has pledged 'self-reliance and self-strengthening' to develop artificial intelligence in China.

articles.title: OpenAI poaches Instacart CEO, Silicon Valley goes to D.C.: Week in AI
articles.author: Business Journal
articles.summary: This week's topic is artificial intelligence in the Bay Area and what you need to know this week about it in the area. For more information, visit CNN iReport.com/ArtificialIntelligence this week and follow them on Twitter @cnnireportal.

articles.title: Cloud computing company, 2 others bringing billions in investments to Las Vegas area
articles.author: Emerson Drewes
articles.summary: TensorWave will open a 20,000-square-foot space in Town Square by this fall and create 60 new jobs with an average wage of $58 per hour. NeuroGum Inc. is opening a 50,000 square-foot distribution and fulfillment facility at 4675 S Valley View Blvd. in August. Dealer Tire LLC is launching a 116,000 sq ft distribution and fulfilment center in Clark County to streamline maintenance and tire delivery operations.

articles.title: Google stock falls as Apple considers adding AI search engines
articles.author: The Hill
articles.summary: Apple is considering adding artificial intelligence search engines to its web browser as search traffic declines. Google's stock took a hit Wednesday after an Apple executive testified in court that the iPhone maker is considering the move.   Google will probably add them to the list but they probably won't be the default.

articles.title: Pender County Schools to discuss changes to AI policies
articles.author: Conor Doherty
articles.summary: The Pender County School District is preparing policy changes surrounding the use of artificial intelligence in the classroom. The policy changes will go through a first reading at the Board of Educations's next meeting on May 13th. If approved, teacher training would begin during the school year that starts this fall, but implementation for students might not occur until the following school year.

articles.title: AI tool uses selfies to predict biological age and cancer survival
articles.author: Issam AHMED
articles.summary: FaceAge is a deep learning algorithm that converts a simple headshot into a number that more accurately reflects a person's biological age. It was trained on 58,851 portraits of presumed-healthy adults over 60 and tested on 6,196 cancer patients treated in the United States and the Netherlands. It pegged cancer patients on average as biologically five years older than healthy peers. It could help doctors decide who can safely tolerate punishing treatments and who might fare better with a gentler approach.

articles.title: New technology helps to transform farming industry ahead of next strawberry season
articles.author: Lizbeth Gutierrez
articles.summary: Harvest Croo completed a field trial of its fully automated strawberry harvesting machine at Wish Farms last season. The machine, known as B8, uses AI machine learning, food safety technology and breeding techniques to pick the berry and pack it. The goal is to have at least three automated harvesting machines at the start of the next strawberry season.

articles.title: Amherst Police investigating ‘misuse' of AI by high school student
articles.author: Rob Petree
articles.summary: Amherst Central High School administration sent a letter to parents about a recent incident involving a student's misuse of an internet-based AI tool called Flow GPT. The software was used by the student to create fictional chat bots that included the names of several students, parents and faculty, as well as some images taken from publicly available sources like social media. Amherst Police are conducting a full investigation.

articles.title: ChatGPT Deep Research can now connect to GitHub
articles.author: Anna Washenko
articles.summary: ChatGPT is bringing its Deep Research service directly into GitHub's developer ecosystem. ChatGPT Plus, Pro and Team users will be the first to receive access over the coming days. Members of the Enterprise and Edu plans will get a chance to try it out "soon."

articles.title: Deepwater's Gene Munster talks if Alphabet shares may fail to rebound
articles.summary: Gene Munster joins Fast Money to talk about AI search sentiment and whether Alphabet will be able to recover from it.       in Google's AI search will be difficult to recover on AI sentiment, he says, as it will affect search sentiment.

articles.title: After winning over House for second year, fate of election deepfakes bill hangs on R.I. Senate
articles.author: Nancy Lavin
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an AI-powered chatbot developed by Jacquelyn Baginski. She is pushing for state regulations limiting artificial intelligence in elections. Last year's proposal sailed through the Rhode Island House of Representatives with a 64-1 vote, with one abstention. The companion legislation from Sen. Lou DiPalma is languishing in the Senate Committee on Judiciary. It will be reviewed this year.

articles.title: AI execs used to beg for regulation. Not anymore.
articles.author: Gerrit De Vynck
articles.summary: Sam Altman, CEO of ChatGPT-maker OpenAI, warned at a Senate hearing Thursday that requiring government approval to release powerful artificial intelligence software would be 'disastrous' for the United States' lead in the technology. Two years ago, he listed creating a new agency to license the technology as his 'number one' recommendation for making sure AI was safe.

articles.title: ‘I Appreciate How Much You Know About Africa'; Why It's Important To Be Nice To Your AI
articles.summary: AI is disrupting Africa's job market. Many jobs are at risk because of AI's ability to process large volumes of tasks. WEF has said AI will create 97 million new roles, particularly in the areas of AI development and human-AI collaboration. Being polite to your AI is crucial.

articles.title: CCSU to offer AI-focused Masters program
articles.author: Jason Levy
articles.summary: Central Connecticut State University has launched a Master of Science in Artificial Intelligence graduate program. The inaugural cohort will be offered in the fall and spring semesters. The course features a 30-32 credit curriculum with specialized training and foundational learning. Core topics include knowledge representation and reasoning, neural networks, semantic web, and machine learning.

articles.title: Google stock falls as Apple considers adding AI search engines
articles.author: Julia Shapero
articles.summary: Eddie Cue testified in court that Apple is considering adding artificial intelligence (AI) search engines to its Safari browser as search traffic declines. Google's stock price fell 9 percent Wednesday. It recovered slightly Thursday. The testimony is part of a multiweek hearing to determine remedies after Google was found to have an illegal monopoly over online search.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence workshop available at Kimball Public Library
articles.author: Kristi Shields
articles.summary: The Rural Prosperity Extension Educator at UNL Jamie Bright is hosting a workshop at the Kimball Public Library May 27 at 5 p.m. to teach people about the basics of artificial intelligence. Bright hosted the first AI workshop in April and wanted to put together a second one that is in the evening so more people would have an opportunity to attend.

articles.title: Legendary band The Who brings farewell tour to Washington. What to know about final shows
articles.author: Kitsap Sun
articles.summary: Roger Daltrey warns that AI could destroy the music industry if it is not careful with the technology. This may be your last chance to hear "Every musician's dream in the early '60s was to make it big in the US charts" in America.

articles.title: Meta Reportedly Eyeing 'Super Sensing' Tech for Smart Glasses
articles.author: Samantha Kelly
articles.summary: Report claims Meta is developing a facial recognition technology for its smart glasses. The company is also working on two new pairs of smart glasses, internally known as Aperol and Bellini. It's also said to be integrating the technology into AI-powered earphones.

articles.title: FDA to Deploy Artificial Intelligence Across Agency
articles.author: Zachary Stieber
articles.summary: The Food and Drug Administration is planning to roll out artificial intelligence across the agency following a successful pilot program. All FDA centers will use a common, secure generative AI system integrated with FDA's internal data platforms by the end of June. President Donald Trump has encouraged agencies to adopt wider use of AI.

articles.title: U.S. looks to expand in AI
articles.author: Basil John
articles.summary: Some of the biggest names in tech testify before the Senate as lawmakers explore how the U.S. can strengthen its position in artificial intelligence. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, executives from Microsoft and Advanced Micro Devices, and Sen. Ted Cruz are testifying. Private AI investment in the US has surged to more than $109 billion, nearly 12 times higher than China's.

articles.title: FDA Centers to Deploy AI Internally
articles.summary: All FDA centers will deploy artificial intelligence internally with full integration on June 30 following the completion of a new generative AI pilot for scientific reviewers. The agency will continue to assess performance, gather user feedback and refine features. Additional details and updates on the AI use will be shared publicly in June.

articles.title: I Brought My Bestselling Wildlife Photography Book to Life with AI
articles.author: Peta Pixel
articles.summary: AI is transforming photography faster than any technology in history. What once took days of travel, planning and waiting for the perfect light can be generated in seconds with the help of a few keystrokes, and can be done by anyone, from anywhere, with just a few keysstrokes.

articles.title: ChatGPT's deep research tool gets a GitHub connector to answer questions about code
articles.author: Kyle Wiggers
articles.summary: ChatGPT's AI-powered 'deep research' can now link to GitHub to answer questions about a codebase and engineering documents. OpenAI has been investing in its tooling for assistive coding. The company has reportedly agreed to buy Windsurf for $3 billion. It also launched fine-tuning options for its AI models.

articles.title: Man murdered in 2021 "speaks" at killer's sentencing hearing thanks to AI video
articles.summary: Chris Pelkey was killed in a road rage incident in Arizona. His family used artificial intelligence to create a video of him reading a victim impact statement. Gabriel Paul Horcasitas, 54, was convicted of manslaughter and sentenced to 10.5 years in prison. The judge "loved" the AI.

articles.title: Amazon's Newest Warehouse Worker Is Called the Vulcan, and It Feels More Than You Know
articles.author: Matt Jancer
articles.summary: Amazon is building a sensitive robot called the Vulcan. It has a sense of touch that will let it pick up and manipulate your Amazon order with less chance of crushing the items to bits. Right now it's able to pick about 75% of the items that one of Amazon's human product pickers does.

articles.title: Planning a Trip? Google Maps Can Scan Your Screenshots and Save Places
articles.author: Rob Pegoraro
articles.summary: Google has added a new feature to Google Maps that lets you create a list of Google Maps locations based on your screenshots. The feature starts rolling out this week in the US in English on iOS and is coming soon to Android. Google is also reminding people to use AI tools to plan trips.

articles.title: SoundHound AI Reports Record First Quarter, Up 151% With $29.1 Million in Revenue
articles.author: Joplin Globe
articles.summary: SoundHound AI, Inc. reports its financial results for the first quarter of 2025. SoundHound is a global leader in voice artificial intelligence and reports it is a profitable company today. It's traded on the Nasdaq: SOUN. For more information, visit: www.soundhoundai.com.

articles.title: Hyundai Partners with AI and Robotics Start-ups for Humanoid Welding Robots
articles.author: The Maritime Executive
articles.summary: HD Hyundai is partnering with AI and robotics start-ups to develop a humanoid robot capable of complex, precise welding tasks as part of the smart shipyard of the future. The companies are saying they aim to 'usher in a new era of human-machine collaboration'

articles.title: AiFi: Interview With CEO Steve Carlin About The Camera-Led Spatial Intelligence Solutions Company
articles.author: Amit Chowdhry
articles.summary: AiFi is a leading spatial intelligence company enabling businesses worldwide to track people and objects through space. Its clients include 17 stadiums globally, such as Intuit Dome for the Los Angeles Clippers and venues like American Express Stadium in the UK and Parken Stadium in Denmark. AiFi has expanded to 280+ stores worldwide, processing 30 million items and deployed in 17 global stadiums.

articles.title: College Students Are Sprinkling Typos Into Their AI Papers on Purpose
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: To avoid AI writing detection, college students are adding typos to their chatbot-generated papers, according to New York. Students explore the ways AI has rapidly changed academia.      Â   - New York's online news service.

articles.title: Self Proclaimed AI Evangelist Buys His Young Daughter A $200 AI-Assisted Dinosaur, But She Disables The AI And Uses It Like An Old Fashioned Doll
articles.author: Michael Levanduski
articles.summary: Alex Volkov bought his daughter an AI-powered dinosaur doll for Christmas, but she didn't like it. Volkov is the founder of a translation service that is powered by AI. Other parents are not surprised that their children don't like the AI features of their toys.

articles.title: Car Dealership Introduces Humanoid Robot Staff
articles.author: Spooky
articles.summary: Mornine is a humanoid robot designed for use in car dealerships. Chery Automobile introduced Mornine at one of its Malaysian dealerships in 2025. The robot uses its speaking skills to explain things about the car to potential buyers, answer their questions, and even assist them with test drives.

articles.title: FDA says it will be 'aggressive' in adopting artificial intelligence in its labs
articles.author: Doug Cunningham
articles.summary: The Food and Drug Administration announced an aggressive timeline to scale use of artificial intelligence internally across all FDA centers by June 30, 2025. FDA Commissioner Dr. Martin A. Makary was 'blown away' by the success of the first AI-assisted scientific review pilot. AI is a transformative technology, but issues have arisen with AI accuracy.

articles.title: Nvidia James Fan Proposes Physical Turing Test
articles.author: Brian Wang
articles.summary: Nvidia researcher James Fan proposes a physical Turing test for robots. He wants them to clean a messy room and prepare a meal for two and set the table. There would be a prepared clean room, the meal cooked and candles lit. 1.5 million parameters is all that is needed to capture the sophistication of the human body for humanoid robot training.

articles.title: AI model translates text commands into motion for diverse robots and avatars
articles.author: Kevin Stacey
articles.summary: MotionGlot is an artificial intelligence model that can generate movement in robots and animated figures in the same way that AI models like ChatGPT generate text. The research will be presented later this month at the 2025 International Conference on Robotics and Automation in Atlanta.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence: 7 eye-opening new scientific discoveries
articles.author: Psy Post
articles.summary: As artificial intelligence becomes woven into the fabric of daily life, scientists are racing to understand its deeper psychological, social, and cognitive impacts. From diagnosing mental health conditions to shaping political beliefs, AI is becoming more and more important to society.

articles.title: Gmail's AI Can Now Read Entire Email Threads to Write Smart Replies
articles.author: Jon Fisher
articles.summary: Gmail adds AI-powered smart replies. It scans entire email threads. Opt-out is available in Gmail settings. Google is rolling out a major update to Gmail that adds smarter, more context-aware replies via Gemini. The feature is already available for Workspace Business and Enterprise users, and admins can turn it on or off through settings.

articles.title: Microsoft's Brad Smith, other tech execs give Congress AI wish list
articles.author: Alex Halverson
articles.summary: Tech leaders from Microsoft, OpenAI, CoreWeave and Advanced Micro Devices appeared before a Senate committee on Thursday. They are calling for looser regulation and heavier investment in AI to support the technology's growth. They don't want to be caught up in escalating trade wars.

articles.title: Should a Killer's Victim Be Able to "Speak" at a Sentencing Through AI?
articles.author: Paul Cassell
articles.summary: Arizona road-rage killer was sentenced to 10 1/2 years in prison after his victim's family played an AI-generated statement with a version of the victim asking the judge for leniency. All 50 states and the federal system allow victims to deliver victim impact statements. The purpose of the statement is to provide relevant information to the sentencers.

articles.title: Amazon's slightly terrifying new warehouse robot comes with "a sense of touch"
articles.author: Craig Hale
articles.summary: Vulcan is Amazon's new warehouse robot. It has two arms, one for rearranging items in compartments and one for item retrieval. Vulcan has already processed over 500,000 orders in pilot deployments across Spokane, Washington and Hamburg, Germany. Amazon has more than 750,000 robots already in use across its warehouses.

articles.title: Apple eyes move to AI search
articles.author: Taipei Times
articles.summary: Apple is looking at revamping the Safari Web browser to focus on artificial intelligence-powered search engines. It's a seismic shift for the industry and a potential end of a longtime industry practice. AI search engines probably won't be the default on Apple's devices.

articles.title: Marco Lucido, Workplace Law: Regulating employers' use of Artificial Intelligence
articles.author: Marco Lucido
articles.summary: The California Civil Rights Council approved the final version of its proposed 'Employment Regulations regarding Automated Decision Systems' on March 21. If adopted, the regulations would regulate an employer's use of AI and other automated decision-making systems in the employment context. The regulations are pending final adoption by the California Office of Administrative Law.

articles.title: OpenAI launches initiative to spread democratic AI through global partnerships
articles.author: Cryptoslate
articles.summary: OpenAI launched a new initiative to help countries build artificial intelligence systems rooted in democratic values. The OpenAI for Countries initiative is part of the firm's broader Stargate project and aims to help these countries develop and use AI that protects and incorporates long-standing democratic principles.

articles.title: California State Colleges Handed Millions of Dollars in Federal, State Funds to ‘Fake Students'
articles.author: Sean Moran
articles.summary: Millions of dollars in federal and state funds are going to fake students. Community colleges are targets because they have high acceptance rates. This year, schools have already given out $3 million in federal aid and $700,000 in state funds. Professors have to make sure their students are actually human.

articles.title: ‘It will probably lead to the end of the world' — what tech bros really think about AI
articles.author: The Times/The Sunday Times
articles.summary: Sam Altman runs OpenAI, the lab that gave us ChatGPT. Sam Altman has just turned 40 and he's one of the most powerful men there has ever been. Sam has guns, gold, potassium iodide, antibiotics, batteries, water, gas masks from the Israeli Defence Force and a big patch of land in Big Sur he can fly to.

articles.title: Not Bought Into Apple Intelligence? Here's What You Can Do
articles.author: Jeff Carlson
articles.summary: According to a new survey, a majority of US adults won't use most AI features of Apple's Apple Intelligence. Some AI features are more welcome than others. It's easy to turn off Apple Intelligence entirely or to selectively disable some of the features. It also lets you reclaim the storage it's using. Apple Intelligence works only on the iPhone 15 Pro, iPhone 16, the iPhone 16E, the 16 Pro or M-series Macs and iPads, plus the newest iPad mini.

articles.title: College Students Are Sprinkling Typos Into Their AI Papers on Purpose
articles.author: Noor Al-Sibai
articles.summary: Some college students are adding typos to their AI-generated papers to avoid AI detection. Iowa teaching assistant Sam Williams is concerned about students using AI to cheat in their studies.    He was shocked by the difference between students' first and second assignments in a general education class on music.

articles.title: Meta's next smart glasses might have an always-on AI – I don't care how useful it is, I'm never turning it on
articles.author: Hamish Hector
articles.summary: According to a leak from The Information, Meta's next smart glasses might have an always-on AI that can track everything you do. The current Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses models are already packed with the sensors they'd need to pull off this feat of AI. The Information's report suggests Meta has reworked its privacy and safety policy to speed up innovation.

articles.title: Apple is planning smart glasses with and without AR
articles.author: Jay Peters
articles.summary: Apple has made progress on a chip for potential smart glasses that would be competitors to the Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses, according to Bloomberg. The company wants mass production to start by the end of 2026 or sometime in 2027, so the glasses themselves could come out within that timeframe. Apple is also working on glasses that use augmented reality.

articles.title: The Responsible Lie: How AI Sells Conviction Without Truth
articles.author: Donna Hancock
articles.summary: The excitement around generative AI is built on a fundamental misunderstanding. What people mistake for understanding is actually statistical association. The architecture at the core of LLMs is fuzzy and incompatible with structured logic or causality. The thinking isn't real, it's simulated and it's not sequential.

articles.title: Academy of Art University Embraces AI as an Essential Tool for Future Artists
articles.author: The Signal
articles.summary: Academy of Art University has incorporated artificial intelligence into its curriculum across disciplines. AI is becoming an increasingly important tool in art and design. Employers will be demanding employees to know how to use it in the future.       .

articles.title: Rezolve Ai Launches in the UAE to Transform Shopping with Next-Gen AI
articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: Rezolve Ai, a global leader in retail-focused artificial intelligence solutions, has launched in the UAE. The platform is designed to empower retailers with end-to-end retail and is based on artificial intelligence.    in the platform is called Rezolve Ai.

articles.title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman and other US tech leaders testify to Congress on AI competition with China
articles.author: Matt Brown
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman and executives from Microsoft and Advanced Micro Devices testify on Capitol Hill about the biggest opportunities, risks and needs facing the artificial intelligence industry. The hearing comes as the race to control the future of artificial intelligence is heating up between companies and countries.

articles.title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman: ChatGPT will ‘probably not' replace Google as top search engine
articles.author: Todd Bishop
articles.summary: A U.S. Senate subcommittee hearing on American AI competitiveness lasted more than three hours. It covered topics including chips, trade, data centers, regulation, energy, workforce, and competition with China. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman called for 'light-touch' regulations. Microsoft President Brad Smith called for smart export policies.

articles.title: Google-Parent Alphabet Shares Decline as More People Use AI for Search
articles.author: Wall Street Journal
articles.summary: There was a drop in Google search traffic on the Safari web browser, according to WSJ's Dan Gallagher. Google is worried about the threat of artificial intelligence in the Internet age.    iReport.com has a photo of the decline in traffic on Safari.

articles.title: AI-designed DNA controls genes in healthy mammalian cells for first time
articles.author: Science Daily
articles.summary: A recent study marks the first reported instance of generative AI designing synthetic molecules that can successfully control gene expression in healthy mammalian cells. As a proof-of-concept, the authors of the study asked the AI to design the molecules as a generator of the research.

articles.title: Quantum computing stock surges after surprising announcement
articles.author: Samuel O'Brient
articles.summary: Quantum computing stocks are rising today after a key announcement from one of the industry's leaders. The industry has been growing steadily, with one particular company leading the way. While quantum computing may not be as trendy as AI, it is evolving quickly and offers investors key opportunities.

articles.title: New study explores role of generative AI in using copyrighted material
articles.summary: Generative artificial intelligence (AI) facilitates the compilation of huge volumes of data, which often includes copyrighted materials. A recent report by the US Copyright Office considers the economic and social implications of AI and copyright policy. It suggests licensing as a potential solution to the problem.

articles.title: Congress tries to figure out how to keep US ahead of China in AI development
articles.author: Austin Denean
articles.summary: Developing AI and creating guardrails for the industry has been a priority for Congress over the last two years. OpenAI's ChatGPT has led an uptick of AI usage by the public and companies. Congress is trying to figure out what protections should become law and how to keep the U.S. as a global leader of the technology.

articles.title: AZ: FAMILY USES AI VICTIM STATEMENT IN COURT
articles.summary: AI used to help late victim tell his story in court as featured on "As featured on CNN.com.    i.e. it helped him to tell the story of his late victim. It also helped others to tell their stories in court.

articles.title: How AI is reshaping student writing
articles.author: Fast Company
articles.summary: Some of my colleagues fear that AI is accelerating a glut of superficial content, impeding students' learning. I'm a writing professor who sees artificial intelligence as more of an opportunity for students, rather than a threat, and I think it's not that they're dishonest.

articles.title: Google says AI is making searching and browsing the web safer
articles.author: Clare Duffy
articles.summary: Google is using AI to better protect its users from scams across Chrome, Search and its Android operating system. Consumers worldwide lost more than $1 trillion to scams last year, according to the Global Anti-Scam Alliance. AI has improved language understanding and pattern recognition, enabling the tech to identify scams faster.

articles.title: Google is using AI to identify scammy websites on Chrome when you click on them
articles.author: Clare Duffy
articles.summary: Google is using AI to better protect its users from scams across Chrome, Search and its Android operating system. Consumers worldwide lost more than $1 trillion to scams last year, according to the Global Anti-Scam Alliance. AI has improved language understanding and pattern recognition, enabling the tech to identify scams faster.

articles.title: Google rolls out AI tools to protect Chrome users against scams
articles.author: Aisha Malik
articles.summary: Google is rolling out new AI-powered defenses to help combat scams on Chrome. The tech giant will begin using Gemini Nano, its on-device large language model (LLM), on desktop to protect users against online scams. It's also launching new warnings for Chrome on Android to help users be aware of spammy notifications.

articles.title: New Study Reveals Troubling Vulnerability Of AI Systems, And Especially Those Used By Medical Professionals
articles.author: Michael Levanduski
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is quickly being adopted by companies around the world. There are some risks associated with AI, such as the fact that it accesses immense amounts of information. A new study looked at medical AI systems. It found that replacing one million of 100 billion training tokens with vaccine misinformation led to a 4.8% increase in harmful content.

articles.title: SoundHound's Amelia 7.0 Platform Delivers Agentic AI With Category Leading Voice Technology
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: SoundHound AI, Inc. (Nasdaq: SOUN) is a global leader in voice artificial intelligence. The latest version of the AI agent is called $SOUN #AIagent and it's available on the SoundHound's website.

articles.title: WordPress.com AI Website Builder – Archyde: Latest World News, Economy, Entertainment, Health, Technology & Sports Updates
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: AI website builders are revolutionizing the world of web design. Ava Sharma is a leading expert in AI-driven web design and the founder of WebGenius, a company pioneering the use of artificial intelligence in website progress. She sees the future of AI-powered web design as being deeply integrated into every aspect of the industry.

articles.title: Scary new AI trend should terrify job seekers
articles.author: Samuel O’Brient
articles.summary: Duolingo is restructuring to become "AI-first" and replace human workers with AI. The company has already replaced at least one hundred people with AI systems. This trend is worrying early-career job seekers, especially college grads who are struggling to break into their chosen field.

articles.title: Scary new AI trend should terrify job seekers
articles.author: Samuel O'Brient
articles.summary: People have been worried about AI replacing human workers for years. The launch of ChatGPT in 2022 kicked off the current chatbot revolution, which has increased people's fears about AI's potential to replace humans with it.      .

articles.title: Exhibit your startup at TechCrunch Sessions: AI while you still can!
articles.author: Tech Crunch Events
articles.summary: TechCrunch Sessions: AI is coming to UC Berkeley's Zellerbach Hall on June 5th. The deadline for booking a table is Friday, May 9th at 11:59 p.m. PT. Exhibiting at the event gives you access to the AI community and other benefits.

articles.title: Coding emerges as generative AI's breakout star
articles.author: Mark Sullivan
articles.summary: Half of all LLM usage is for writing computer code. Businesses are rushing to capitalize on the efficiency gains offered by AI coding. Anysphere's Cursor raised $900 million at a $9 billion valuation and OpenAI acquired Windsurf for $3 billion.

articles.title: Academy of Art University Embraces AI as an Essential Tool for Future Artists
articles.author: Sponsored Post
articles.summary: Academy of Art University offers a Master of Arts degree in Artificial Intelligence Design. It offers over 17 AI-focused courses across undergraduate and graduate programs. According to reports, 76% of professionals believe they need AI skills to remain competitive in the workforce. 70% of leaders hesitate to hire candidates without AI skills.

articles.title: How to tell if a photo's fake? You probably can't. That's why new rules are needed
articles.author: Martin Bekker
articles.summary: Photo manipulation tools are so good and easy to use that a picture's truthfulness is no longer guaranteed. Anyone with an internet connection can cook up any image with photorealistic quality and present it as real. I teach and research the ethics of artificial intelligence. I suggest a system where creators and users of images openly state what changes they've made.

articles.title: GenAI, Legal Ops, And The Human Advantage
articles.author: Above The Law
articles.summary: Conference attendees at CLOC Global Institute are concerned about the impact of AI on legal ops professionals. Mike Haven and Prashant Dubey discuss the 12 core competencies of legal ops. They argue that AI can't replace the human attributes that will become even more critical in the future.

articles.title: 5 underrated ChatGPT prompts you should be using every day
articles.summary: OpenAI debuts ChatGPT o3 and o4-mini models. Here are 5 useful GPT prompts to use all the time. They are: Context, Format, Constraints and Examples, Mind Reset Template, Micro-learning Template and Everyday Discovery Template.

articles.title: Digital Silk Launches New AI-Enhanced Mobile UX Services to Help New York Universities Boost Student Applications
articles.author: Newsfile Corp.
articles.summary: Digital Silk has launched its new AI-enhanced Mobile UX Service for New York's higher education institutions.
